title: Inside the Trump Administration’s Push to Prosecute James Comey
summary: President Trump’s campaign of retribution began to intensify in mid-July and hit a fever pitch over the last week, culminating in the indictment of one of his foremost enemies.

title: Trump’s Repeated Attacks May Undercut Case Against Comey
summary: The president’s voluble vitriol could provide defense lawyers with an avenue to protect the very people he most wants to punish.

title: Examining James Comey’s 2020 Testimony at the Heart of His Indictment
summary: The charges against the former F.B.I. director center on an appearance he made before a Senate committee in September 2020. Here’s a closer look.

title: Trump Says He Has Ordered Troops to Portland, Oregon, to Protect ICE Facilities
summary: The president characterized Immigration and Customs Enforcement facilities as being under siege from domestic terrorists.

title: FBI Fires Agents Seen Kneeling During 2020 Racial Justice Protests
summary: Agents group says the latest dismissals are part of a “dangerous pattern” of weakening the nation’s top law enforcement agency.

title: Des Moines Schools Superintendent Arrested By ICE Is Placed on Leave
summary: School Board members in Iowa’s capital made the decision one day after immigration officials accused the superintendent, Ian Roberts, of being in the country illegally.

title: Restoring the Sound, if Not the Fury, of William Faulkner’s Piano
summary: Hoping to draw more visitors to Rowan Oak, Faulkner’s home in Oxford, Miss., a group helped refurbish its piano.

title: For Many Moldovans, Their Election Is a Choice Between Russia and the E.U.
summary: Parliamentary elections in this nation bordering Ukraine come at a critical moment in Moldova’s push for European Union membership.

title: Netanyahu’s Defiant U.N. Speech Aimed at Home as Well as the World
summary: The Israeli prime minister faced walkouts and protests at the United Nations, but signaled that resisting Palestinian statehood could become the core of his appeal to Israeli voters.

title: U.S. Ambassador to Israel Is Expected to Make Rare Visit to Egypt
summary: Ambassador Mike Huckabee is to travel to Cairo for talks that officials said would focus on the Gaza war and tensions between Israel and Egypt.

title: Iranians Brace for Economic Impact of New U.N. Sanctions
summary: Already suffering a 40 percent inflation rate and critical shortages of power and water, many in Iran expect conditions to get worse.

title: Oura Heath’s C.E.O. Knows the Secret to Better Sleep
summary: Oura Health makes a pricey smart ring that busy executives, celebrities and others use to track health measures like their sleep patterns. It expects $1 billion in sales this year.

title: New Retail Leaders Confront Trump’s Tariffs, Policy Shifts and Weak Spending
summary: New retail C.E.O.s are facing unexpected challenges, like tariffs and worried shoppers, as they try to address existing ones.

title: His Parents Disappeared. In a TV Studio, He Confessed to Killing Them.
summary: After investigators came looking, Lorenz Kraus told a reporter he had strangled Franz and Theresia Kraus eight years ago. Two bodies were buried in their backyard.

title: Frida Kahlo’s Prequel: A New Museum Shows Her Family Roots
summary: In a former residence in Mexico City, passed down through the Kahlo family, it presents an intimate side of the Mexican painter’s life.

title: C.T.E. Looms Over Friday Night Lights
summary: Parents revealed conflicting emotions after the finding that a gunman who killed four people in July had the brain disease that has been linked with football and other contact sports.

title: RFK Jr. Is Focused on the Wrong Pesticide
summary: This debate is what happens when politics, vibes and hysteria drown out science, facts and data.

title: Why Comey Should Not Have Been Indicted, According to Trump
summary: Why James Comey should not have been indicted, according to Trump.

title: Gunman Fires on Riverside Bar in North Carolina From Boat, Killing 3
summary: Eight others were injured in the attack on the bar in Southport, N.C., the authorities said. The gunman escaped on the boat.

title: A Man Is Linked to the Brutal ‘Yogurt Shop Murders’ 34 Years Ago
summary: Police said they used DNA to identify a suspect in the Austin killings known as the yogurt shop murders. The case has haunted the city for decades.

title: Stampede at Actor’s Political Rally Kills at Least 36 in India
summary: The stampede took place at an event for Joseph Vijay Chandrasekhar, the popular actor known professionally as Vijay. A health official said the toll was likely to rise.
